column1: *Rows 3 and 4 are ignored on import.  We use these rows to describe the legal values for cells above and below.
column2:
*Type is very important.  
For Systems import, Type should be "Systems". (in cell A2)

column1:
*Required

If you have a standardized acronym or other specific reason for entering Codes manually, we recommend doing so.

Enter the Codes for already existing objects if you want to use Import as a means to edit and update those objects.
column2:
*Required

Titles are required text fields.  You MUST fill in a Title for all Systems in order to import them.
column3: *Description is an optional text field.  If you have the description available, we recommend entering it now.  Otherwise, it can be filled in later.
column4:
*Optional.

Date fields should always follow standard formats such as year/month/date in the form of xxxx/xx/xx
column5:
*Optional.
Enter a valid URL

Example:
www.reciprocitylabs.com
column6:
*Optional.
Enter a valid reference URL

Example:
www.reciprocitylabs.com
column7:
* Notes
Use this text field to keep notes about this System
column8:
*Optional.
You can map a person to be the Owner/Person of Contact for the System by entering an email address that already exists in your gGRC instance. Only 1 email address may be entered.

Example:

jeff@reciprocitylabs.com
column9:
*Optional.  

You can link Controls to Systems on import by specifying the Control code.  Use <option><return> to delineate between Control Codes.
Example:

CONTROL-1
CONTROL-2
column10:
*Optional.  

You can link Systems to other Systems on import by specifying the System code.  Use <option><return> to delineate between System Codes.
Example:

SYSTEM-1
SYSTEM-2
column11:
*Optional.  

You can map Processes to Systems on import by specifying the Process code.  Use <option><return> to delineate between Process Codes.
Example:

PROCESS-1
PROCESS-2
column12:
*Optional.  

You can link Systems to Org Groups on import by specifying the Org Groups code.  Use <option><return> to delineate between Org Groups.
Example:

ORGGROUP-1
ORGGROUP-2
column14:
*Optional.  
Can be "Yes", "True", or "1" to result in the System being labeled as "Infrastructure".

Can be "No", "False", "0" to result in System being labeled as "Not Infrastructure"
column15:
*Optional.
Can be "Draft", "Final", "Effective", "Ineffective", "Launched", "Not Launched", "In Scope", or "Not in Scope"

column2: System with same code as some process
